column5: Hi Everyone,  This past hunting season a resident of Belleville was deer hunting and harvested a dream come true for many deer hunters. His name is Mark Sorge and he took this fine specimen a 23 point buck that is now officially scored for the Boone and Crockett record book as well as FROW the Ontario record book. The buck scored an impressive 240.0 points and is officially the # 2 buck of all time in Ontario.  Carra Outdoor Sports mounted this buck and it is on display at our store for a couple of months. If you are interested in viewing him come on in and I am sure you will be impressed by this magnificent creature. I have attached a quick pic.  Regards, Sam
That is a beautiful deer you did a great job on the mount Sam  Rob

Yes i remember when he shot that sam !!! WOW,big buck for sure,hats off to you for mounting the monster buck sam  those antlers are soooo,thick too,very healthy deer,would he have been eating corn & stuff,or was he deep in the bush eating other food ????i dont hunt but i always find it interesting...congrats to him,for setting a few records,WTG...
HOLY COW! I mean HOLY BUCK! Just a beautiful animal. Would love to see that! Thanks for posting Sam.
BUCK ME, thats a big deer!

had a chance to see this mount 'in progress' a few weeks ago . quite the impressive animal , especially in person.  Still remember Randys ( fishhunter ) repsonse  I'll have to stop by and see the finished product  TB
Great work on the mount Sam! Beauty of a Buck thats for darn sure
Nice to see the finally product Sam.  VERY NICE!  Just wondering what the deer weighed in at?
This buck weighed in at 246 lbs.  Regards, Sam
I'm heading over to Belleville next week. I'll drop by and see that.
Awesome Sam  Do you know the rough area it was taken, I have seen some real monsters near my brothers place just south of Stirling.
I know absolutely squat about hunting....but....that is one impressive buck!!!
wow !   that is one amazing buck.  a once in a lifetime trophy for sure.  great job on the mount.  jason

Yes I do know where this buck was taken and it was just north of 401 on Harmony Road, the funny thing is I seen him last year on the property next to where I was hunting geese and he looked big then and I could not tell how big he really was and I also could not hunt on the property that the deer was living on. He was seen daily in the corn field from a distance and I could not tell how many points and the funny part was that he was always under a tree stand. Well I did get to see him again when he came in to get mounted. He is impressive and I am pleased that I was able to mount it for the owner.  Regards, Sam
looks great sam! i couldnt belive my eyes when i saw that deer in person at the shop, looks amazing!
Great mount Sam,That was the rack you showed me ,back in november......TC and tight lines......Chuck...
wow , what a brute . the 8 pt'er on my wall just got small in a hurry next to that giant. love that drop-tine.  great mount on an impressive monarch.    again,,,WOW.
That is one impressive buck. Nice job you did on the mount.
